org.gearvrf

Class GVRShaderTemplate

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gearvrf.GVRShader
      • org.gearvrf.GVRShaderTemplate
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    GVRAccessibilityPostEffectShader, GVRColorShader, GVRConsole.ConsoleShader, GVRCubemapReflectionShader, GVRCubemapShader, GVRDepthShader, GVRErrorShader, GVRLightmapShader, GVROESShader, GVRPhongLayeredShader, GVRPhongShader, GVRTextureShader, GVRUnlitFBOShader, GVRUnlitHorizontalStereoShader, GVRUnlitVerticalStereoShader

    public class GVRShaderTemplate
extends GVRShader
    Generates a set of native vertex and fragment shaders from source code segments.

    Each shader template keeps a set of named source code segments which are used to compose the shaders. The code in the "FragmentTemplate" slot is the master template for the fragment shader, the one attached as "VertexTemplate" is the master for the vertex shader. Any name in the fragment template that starts with "@Fragment" is replaced by the shader segment attached in that slot. Similarly, names in the vertex template that start with "@Vertex" are replaced with vertex shader segments. This permits multiple segments to be combined into a single fragment or vertex shader. The segment names are also #defined in the shader for conditional compilation.

    To generate different variants from the same source we use #ifdef creatively. Any shader variable name starting with a "HAS_" is assumed to be a #ifdef that affects the generated code. These names typically correspond to uniforms, textures or vertex buffer attributes. If these parameters are defined by the material or mesh, that name will be #defined to 1 in the shader. Otherwise, it will not be defined.

    Each shader variant generated has a unique signature so that the same variant will not be generated twice. The shader also defines descriptors that define the names and types of all the uniforms, textures and vertex attributes used by the shader. For uniforms and attributes, each entry is a float or integer type, an optional count and the name of the uniform (e.g. "float3 diffuse_color, float specular_exponent, int is_enabled". For textures, the descriptor contains the sampler type followed by the name: (e.g. "sampler2D u_texture; samplerCube u_cubemap")

    Multiple lights are supported by specifying light shader source code segments in GVRLightBase. You can define different light implementations with their own data structures and these will be included in the generated fragment shader.

    See Also:
    GVRPhongShader, GVRLightBase

    • Constructor Detail

      • GVRShaderTemplate

        public GVRShaderTemplate(java.lang.String uniformDescriptor,
                         java.lang.String textureDescriptor,
                         java.lang.String vertexDescriptor)
        Construct a shader template for a shader using GLSL version 100. To make a shader for another version use the other form of the constructor.
        Parameters:
        uniformDescriptor - string describing uniform names and types e.g. "float4 diffuse_color, float4 specular_color, float specular_exponent"
        textureDescriptor - string describing texture names and types e.g. "sampler2D diffuseTexture, sampler2D specularTexture"
        vertexDescriptor - string describing vertex attributes and types e.g. "float3 a_position, float2 a_texcoord"

      • GVRShaderTemplate

        public GVRShaderTemplate(java.lang.String uniformDescriptor,
                         java.lang.String textureDescriptor,
                         java.lang.String vertexDescriptor,
                         GVRShader.GLSLESVersion glslVersion)
        Construct a shader template
        Parameters:
        uniformDescriptor - string describing uniform names and types e.g. "float4 diffuse_color, float4 specular_color, float specular_exponent"
        textureDescriptor - string describing texture names and types e.g. "sampler2D diffuseTexture, sampler2D specularTexture"
        vertexDescriptor - string describing vertex attributes and types e.g. "float3 a_position, float2 a_texcoord"
        glslVersion - GLSL version (e.g. GLSLESVersion.V300)

    • Method Detail

      • setSegment

        protected void setSegment(java.lang.String segmentName,
                          java.lang.String shaderSource)
        Attach a named shader segment. Shader segment names should start with either "Vertex" or "Fragment" to designate which type of shader the code belongs with. Both vertex and fragment shaders can have more than one code segment contribute to the final shader.
        Overrides:
        setSegment in class GVRShader
        Parameters:
        segmentName - name associated with shader segment
        shaderSource - String with shader source code

      • generateLightSignature

        protected java.lang.String generateLightSignature(GVRLightBase[] lightlist)
        Create a unique signature for the lights used by this shader variant. The signature will include the names of the light source classes and how many times each is used in the shader.
        Parameters:
        lightlist - list of lights used with this shader
        Returns:
        light string signature for shader

      • generateVariantDefines

        protected java.lang.String generateVariantDefines(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> definedNames,
                                                  java.lang.String vertexDesc,
                                                  GVRShaderData material)
        Generates the set of unique parameter names that make a particular variant of the shader from the source template. Wherever the source template contains "HAS_" followed by a name of a uniform, texture or attribute used in the material or mesh, a "#define" for that name is generated.
        Parameters:
        definedNames - set with defined names for this shader
        vertexDesc - String with vertex attributes, null to ignore them
        material - material used with this shader (may not be null)
        Returns:
        shader signature string with names actually defined by the material and mesh

      • bindShader

        public int bindShader(GVRContext context,
                      IRenderable rdata,
                      GVRScene scene,
                      boolean isMultiview)
        Select the specific vertex and fragment shader to use. The shader template is used to generate the sources for the vertex and fragment shader based on the vertex, material and light properties. This function may compile the shader if it does not already exist.
        Overrides:
        bindShader in class GVRShader
        Parameters:
        context - GVRContext
        rdata - renderable entity with mesh and material
        scene - scene being rendered

      • bindShader

        public int bindShader(GVRContext context,
                      GVRShaderData material,
                      java.lang.String meshDesc)
        Select the specific vertex and fragment shader to use with this material. The shader template is used to generate the sources for the vertex and fragment shader based on the material properties only. It will ignore the mesh attributes and all lights.
        Overrides:
        bindShader in class GVRShader
        Parameters:
        context - GVRContext
        material - material to use with the shader
        meshDesc - string with vertex descriptor
        Returns:
        ID of vertex/fragment shader set

      • getRenderDefines

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> getRenderDefines(IRenderable renderable,
                                                                              GVRScene scene)
        Generate shader-specific defines from the rendering information. You can override this function in your shader class to change which variant is generated depending on the GVRRenderData settings. The base implementation LIGHTSOURCES as 0 if lighting is not enabled by the render data, and it defines SHADOWS as 1 if any light source enables shadow casting.
        Parameters:
        renderable - object being rendered by this shader
        scene - scene being rendered
        Returns:
        list of symbols to be defined (value 1) or undefined (value 0) in the shader
        See Also:
        setCastShadow
